Use the provided learning_objectives, active_learning_components, scaffolding_layers, research_context (definitions from crowdstrike.com/commission.europa.eu; GDPR scope, fines, principles), and flashcard_generation_schema EXACTLY. Topic Hierarchy: {level1: 'Cybersecurity', level2: 'Software Development Security', level3: 'Acquired Software Security Assessment', level4: '004_Compliance and Regulatory Alignment', level5: '004_006_Privacy and Data Protection Regulations', level6: 'General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Compliance'}. Concept Map: Central 'GDPR Compliance' → Personal Data/Processing → Controller/Processor → Principles/Standards (ISO 27001/NIST CSF: Identify/Protect/Detect/Respond/Recover) → Implementation (DPIA/DPO/DPAs) → Integration (DevSecOps/CCPA). Generate exactly 25 flashcards in a JSON array. Cover all Bloom levels (4-5 per level), all scaffolding layers, and acquired software focus (e.g., vendor DPAs, third-party DPIAs). Questions progress scaffolding. Incorporate active learning scenarios. Output ONLY valid JSON matching schema—no extra text. Sources: EU Commission, CrowdStrike.
